name: The Papal Summons
text: A messenger bearing the seal of His Holiness arrives at court, his weathered face speaking of a long journey from the Eternal City. The parchment he carries bears the unmistakable papal bull - the Pope himself calls upon the faithful rulers of Christendom. In these times of spiritual upheaval, when heretics question the true faith and infidels hold the Holy Land, the Vicar of Christ seeks to assert his divine authority over temporal matters. The Church's coffers run deep, but its spiritual authority runs deeper still. How shall we answer this summons from the successor of Saint Peter?

name: Papal Authority Established
text: With our submission to the Holy See complete, papal legates now walk our halls with impunity, their red vestments a constant reminder of Rome's reach. The Church's influence permeates every aspect of governance - from the appointment of bishops who sit in our councils to the collection of tithes that flow steadily to Saint Peter's coffers. Yet with this submission comes power of a different sort: the ability to call upon the Church's vast resources, to legitimize our rule through divine sanction, and to wage holy war with Heaven's blessing.

name: Conflict with Rome
text: Our defiance of papal authority has not gone unnoticed in the halls of the Lateran Palace. Whispers speak of an impending interdict - a spiritual weapon that would see our lands stripped of the sacraments, our people denied salvation, and our rule questioned by every bishop from here to Jerusalem. The Pope's temporal power may be limited, but his spiritual authority can topple thrones. Already, some of our more pious nobles look upon us with suspicion. The question now becomes: do we stand firm in our conviction, or seek reconciliation before the full weight of excommunication falls upon us?

choices.text: Stand firm! We shall establish our own religious authority!

name: The Antipope Crisis
text: Christendom stands divided! Two men claim the throne of Saint Peter, each backed by powerful kingdoms and each declaring the other a pretender and heretic. Cardinals flee Rome in confusion, bishops declare for one Pope or the other, and the faithful know not which voice speaks with divine authority. This schism in the Church presents both terrible danger and unprecedented opportunity. The very foundations of ecclesiastical power shake, and in this chaos, a clever ruler might reshape the religious landscape of Europe forever. But choose carefully - backing the wrong claimant could see our realm under interdict for generations.
